name: init --help
stdout:
Usage: augx init [options] [command]

Initialize Augment Extensions in current project (includes Beads integration if
.beads/ exists)

Options:
  --from-submodule  Initialize from existing submodule
  -h, --help        display help for command

Commands:
  beads             Initialize Beads task tracking in current project

assertions.name: stdout_contains_Initialize Augment E
assertions.actual:
Usage: augx init [options] [command]

Initialize Augment Extensions in current project (includes Bea

name: list --help
stdout:
Usage: augx list [options]

List available or linked extension modules

Options:
  --linked    Show only linked modules
  --json      Output as JSON
  -h, --help  display help for command

assertions.name: stdout_contains_List available
assertions.actual:
Usage: augx list [options]

List available or linked extension modules

Options:
  --linked    Show

name: list
stdout:
Available Modules:

‚óã coding-standards/bash (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive Bash coding standards for professional, maintainable, and secure Bash scripts across automation, CI/CD, CLI tools, configuration, data processing, system administration, and cross-platform development.
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/css (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive CSS coding standards for modern web development with styling, layouts, responsiveness, and preprocessors (Sass, Less)
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/html (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive HTML coding standards for modern web development with semantic HTML, accessibility guidelines, and HTML5 features
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/html-css-js (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive HTML/CSS/JavaScript coding standards for modern web development with semantic HTML, modern CSS features, and ES6+ JavaScript
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/js (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive JavaScript coding standards for modern web development with ES6+, DOM manipulation, async patterns, and framework integration
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/php (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive PHP coding standards following PSR standards and modern PHP best practices across various project types including web applications, APIs, CLI tools, CMS integrations, e-commerce systems, and legacy migrations.
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/powershell (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive PowerShell coding standards for professional, maintainable, and secure PowerShell code across automation, modules, DSC, cloud orchestration, administrative tools, cross-platform scripts, and legacy migrations.
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/python (v1.1.0)
  Comprehensive Python coding standards including naming conventions, type hints (PEP 484, 585, 604), and error handling
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/react (v1.0.0)
  Modern React patterns including component design, hooks, and state management best practices
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã coding-standards/typescript (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive TypeScript coding standards and best practices
  Type: coding-standards

‚óã domain-rules/api-design (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive API design guidelines including REST, GraphQL, versioning, and best practices
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/database (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive database design guidelines including schema design, normalization, indexing, and best practices
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/catppuccin-latte (v1.0.0)
  Soothing light theme with pastel colors (Latte variant)
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/catppuccin-mocha (v1.0.0)
  Soothing dark theme with pastel colors (Mocha variant)
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/dracula (v1.0.0)
  Dark theme with purple and pink accents inspired by the popular Dracula color scheme
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/gruvbox-dark (v1.0.0)
  Retro-inspired dark theme with warm earthy tones
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/gruvbox-light (v1.0.0)
  Retro-inspired light theme with warm earthy tones
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/high-contrast (v1.0.0)
  Accessibility-focused theme with maximum contrast for better readability
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/monokai (v1.0.0)
  Dark theme with vibrant colors inspired by the classic Monokai editor theme
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/nord (v1.0.0)
  Arctic-inspired dark theme with cool blue tones
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/one-dark (v1.0.0)
  Popular dark theme inspired by Atom's One Dark
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/one-light (v1.0.0)
  Popular light theme inspired by Atom's One Light
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/solarized-dark (v1.0.0)
  Dark theme with warm tones based on the Solarized color palette
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/solarized-light (v1.0.0)
  Light theme with warm tones based on the Solarized color palette
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/design/color/themes/tokyo-night (v1.0.0)
  Dark theme inspired by Tokyo's neon-lit nights
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/mcp (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive guidelines for designing and implementing Model Context Protocol systems including token-based, state-based, vector-based, hybrid, graph-augmented, and compressed MCP
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/security (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive security guidelines including OWASP best practices, authentication, encryption, and secure coding
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/seo-sales-marketing (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive marketing and sales content standards for AI-driven content creation
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/software-architecture (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive software architecture design patterns, principles, and best practices covering monolithic, microservices, event-driven, serverless, and industry-specific architectures
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/wordpress (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive WordPress development guidelines including themes, plugins, blocks, and best practices
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã domain-rules/wordpress-plugin (v1.1.0)
  Comprehensive WordPress plugin development guidelines covering plugin structure, architecture patterns, admin interfaces, frontend functionality, Gutenberg blocks, REST API, AJAX, database management, security, performance, WooCommerce integration, testing patterns, and WordPress.org submission.
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã examples/design-patterns (v1.0.0)
  Common design patterns with TypeScript/JavaScript implementations and use cases
  Type: examples

‚óã examples/gutenberg-block-plugin (v1.0.0)
  Complete Gutenberg block plugin examples with block.json, React components, InspectorControls, RichText, MediaUpload, and build process
  Type: examples

‚óã examples/rest-api-plugin (v1.0.0)
  Complete REST API plugin examples with custom endpoints (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), authentication, validation, error handling, and JavaScript client examples
  Type: examples

‚óã examples/woocommerce-extension (v1.0.0)
  Complete WooCommerce extension examples with custom product fields, checkout customization, payment gateway, order hooks, and WooCommerce best practices
  Type: examples

‚óã visual-design (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive visual design module with vendor-specific design systems (Google Material 3, Microsoft Fluent 2, Amazon Cloudscape) and domain-specific styles (Website, Web-app, Mobile, .NET, Linux, Windows, Motion Picture, AI Prompt Helper, Print Campaigns). Provides design elements, principles, and skills for AI-driven design generation.
  Type: domain-rules

‚óã workflows/adr-support (v1.0.0)
  Automatic Architecture Decision Record (ADR) management with decision detection, lifecycle tracking, templates, and integration with OpenSpec and Beads workflows
  Type: workflow

‚óã workflows/beads (v1.0.0)
  Distributed, git-backed graph issue tracker for AI agents. Provides persistent, structured memory for coding agents with dependency tracking.
  Type: workflows

‚óã workflows/beads-integration (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive guidelines and automation for AI-driven Beads task generation, OpenSpec decomposition, and workflow integration
  Type: workflow

‚óã workflows/database (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive workflow for database design, schema development, migration management, optimization, and testing. Covers relational, NoSQL, vector, and flat databases.
  Type: workflow

‚óã workflows/wordpress-plugin (v1.2.0)
  Complete workflows for WordPress plugin development including scaffolding, development, testing, and WordPress.org submission processes. Optimized for AI-assisted development with OpenSpec and Beads integration.
  Type: workflow

‚óã writing-standards/screenplay/genres (v1.0.0)
  Genre-specific rules and guidelines for screenplay writing across 18+ film genres
  Type: writing-standards

‚óã writing-standards/screenplay (v1.0.0)
  Comprehensive screenplay writing and crafting standards for AI-driven content creation across AAA Hollywood films, independent films, TV series, web content, news broadcasts, commercials, streaming content, and live TV productions
  Type: writing-standards

‚óã writing-standards/screenplay/styles (v1.0.0)
  Narrative style rules and techniques for screenplay writing across 13+ storytelling approaches
  Type: writing-standards

‚óã writing-standards/screenplay/themes (v1.0.0)
  Thematic integration rules and guidelines for screenplay writing across 15+ universal themes
  Type: writing-standards

Total: 45 module(s)

name: show --help
stdout:
Usage: augx show [options] <module> [file-path]

Display detailed information about a module (use "completed" to show Beads
completed tasks, "linked" for linked modules, "all" for all modules)

Options:
  --json                Output as JSON
  --content             Display aggregated content from all module files
  --format <format>     Output format: json, markdown, text (default: "text")
  --depth <number>      Recursion depth for submodules (max 5) (default: "1")
  --filter <pattern>    Filter files by glob pattern (e.g., "*.md")
  --search <term>       Search within module content
  --page <number>       Page number for paginated output
  --page-size <number>  Number of items per page (default: 10)
  --secure              Redact sensitive data (API keys, secrets, tokens,
                        passwords)
  --no-cache            Disable caching for this inspection
  --open                Open file in VS Code editor
  --preview             Open file in VS Code preview pane
  --since <date>        Filter completed tasks since date (ISO 8601 format,
                        e.g., 2026-01-01)
  --until <date>        Filter completed tasks until date (ISO 8601 format,
                        e.g., 2026-12-31)
  --limit <number>      Limit number of completed tasks shown
  --search <term>       Search completed tasks by title, description, or close
                        reason
  --labels <labels>     Filter completed tasks by labels (comma-separated)
  --type <type>         Filter completed tasks by issue type (e.g., task, epic,
                        bug)
  --priority <number>   Filter completed tasks by priority (0-3)
  --assignee <email>    Filter completed tasks by assignee/owner
  --sort <field>        Sort completed tasks by: date, title, priority
                        (default: date)
  --order <order>       Sort order: asc, desc (default: desc)
  --verbose             Show detailed information for completed tasks
  --quiet               Only output task IDs (one per line)
  -h, --help            display help for command

assertions.name: stdout_contains_Display detailed inf
assertions.actual:
Usage: augx show [options] <module> [file-path]

Display detailed information about a module (use "c

name: show completed
stdout:
No completed tasks found.

Completed tasks are stored in: scripts/completed.jsonl
Close tasks using: bd close <task-id>

stdout:
No completed tasks found.

Completed tasks are stored in: scripts/completed.jsonl
Close tasks using: bd close <task-id>

name: install-rules --help
stdout:
Usage: augx install-rules [options]

Install character count management rule to .augment/rules

Options:
  --quiet                 Suppress output messages
  --setup-hooks           Setup automatic rule installation hooks
  --remove-hooks          Remove automatic rule installation hooks
  --git-hook-type <type>  Git hook type: post-checkout or post-merge (default:
                          post-checkout)
  --force                 Force replace existing rule even if content differs
  --interactive           Prompt for conflict resolution when rule exists with
                          different content
  -h, --help              display help for command
